titleStmt.title: Forasmuch as upon writs of error retornable into this High Court of Parliament, the plaintiffs therein desire to delay justice, rather then to come to the determination of the right of the cause it is therefore ordered by the Lords spiritual and temporal in Parliament assembled, that the plaintiffs in all such writs after the same, and the records be brought in, shall speedily repair to the clerk of the Parliament, and prosecute their writs of error ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords.

titleStmt.title: Forasmuch as upon writs of error retornable into this High Court of Parliament, the plaintiffs therein desire to delay justice, rather then to come to the determination of the right of the cause it is therefore ordered by the Lords spiritual and temporal in Parliament assembled, that the plaintiffs in all such writs after the same, and the records be brought in, shall speedily repair to the clerk of the Parliament, and prosecute their writs of error ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker ...,

notesStmt.note: Title from first 7 lines of text.
At head of title: Die Veneris, 13 Decemb. 1661.
"Die Veneris, 13 Decemb. 1661. Ordered by the Lords spiritual and temporal in Parliament assembled, that this order be forthwith printed and published. Jo. Brown, cleric. Parliamentorum."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
